section.title: New Features
section.p: Eucalyptus 4.1.0 introduces the following new features.

row.entry: Tech preview support for Virtual Private Clouds (VPC)
This release adds limited technical preview support for Virtual Private Clouds (VPC). For more information, see .
This release adds limited technical preview support for CloudFormation. For more information, see .
We've added or enhanced support for image management and S3 storage management to the User Console. For more information, see .
Preliminary support for client request log tracking

Client request log tracking makes it easier to troubleshoot issues in your cloud by assigning a unique identifier to each client request. This identifier can be traced throughout the system to help debug problems. For more information, see .

You can now query Eucalyptus for EC2 status information. We also modified the behavior for instance restoration. Cloud users can now find out operational status information on their instances for themselves. Administrators have better visibility of system status.
Instance restoration occurs when you have an instance running in your cloud and somehow (network partition or other factor where communication is lost with an NC) and the metadata that relates to the instance gets lost and the instance is terminated and the record is deleted but that node can come back. We originally tried to restore the original network resources.
SYSTEMSTATUS: reflects whether the NC that the instance is running on is available or not.
New CW metrics: StatusCheckFailed StatusCheckFailed_Instance StatusCheckFailed_System
New timeout: used to be 12 hours, now is 180 days.
For more information, see .
